visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a line chart with the following specifications: Chart type: line, Chart title: 'Monthly Sales Data', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark gray color (#333) for axis labels and titles, with a font size of 14px. Data series: Include two series, 'January' with data points (1, 2), (2, 3), (3, 5), (4, 7) and 'February' with data points (1, 3), (2, 4), (3, 6), (4, 8). Custom colors: Use '#007399' for the 'January' series and '#FF6600' for the 'February' series. Additional configurations: Set the chart background to light gray (#f4f4f4), add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and set the chart margins to 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a line chart titled 'Monthly Sales Data'. The chart type is set to 'line', and it includes two data series: 'January' and 'February', each with specific data points. The chart's background is set to light gray (#f4f4f4), and the margins are adjusted to 50 pixels on all sides for better spacing. The axes and labels are styled with a dark gray color (#333) and a font size of 14px, ensuring readability. The legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart, centered horizontally. Custom colors are applied to each series: '#007399' for 'January' and '#FF6600' for 'February', providing a distinct visual representation for each month's data.
